title: Hoping to ID two fonts
content:
Hello all -- I recently found this site and I am pleased to have stumbled upon you gurus.

I was hoping someone could help me ID two separate fonts, or suggest possible alternatives: 1) company logo (attached), and 2) Smythson's custom "Brook Street" lettering -- can be found at [www.smythson.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.smythson.com/ "www.smythson.com") while customizing "Personalised Stationery."

Thank you for your time and help!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2013-02-09 at 4.50.30 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-02-09%20at%204.50.30%20PM.png) | 9.21 KB |
author: rgs1400

comments.content:
Hello  
I think for & you can use Garamond:  
 [http://www.whatfontis.com/Original-Garamond-BoldMultilingual.font?text=-](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.whatfontis.com/Original-Garamond-BoldMultilingual.font?text=- "http://www.whatfontis.com/Original-Garamond-BoldMultilingual.font?text=-")  
and for JKP you can use Futura Medium:  
 [http://www.whatfontis.com/Futura-Medium-paratype.font?text=JKP](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.whatfontis.com/Futura-Medium-paratype.font?text=JKP "http://www.whatfontis.com/Futura-Medium-paratype.font?text=JKP")  
Alex  
I found it using: [http://www.whatfontis.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.whatfontis.com/ "http://www.whatfontis.com") - Identify the font you are looking for!
The |J|, |K| and |P| look to be simply Futura. Can’t ID the |&| sorry, it looks familiar but I can nearly never remember the font based purely on the ampersand.

1) As previously said, very generic, nothing really specific. Suggestions by Alex look fine to me.  
2) sorry, don't understand what you want exactly... Do you mean "Bond Street"? Because I wasn't able to spot any "Brook Street" lettering anywhere... For the rest, Smythson identity has been designed by [Saturday](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/saturday-london.com/category/clients/smythson/). They may use some bespoke typeface for all their materials. On their website, thery're using [Brandon Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/hvdfonts/brandon-grotesque/) and [Electra Display](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/electra/) but I suppose it's not the one you're after.  
For the rest, can't get out of my head that main woodmark SMYTHSON could be easily done starting with some [Futura Extra Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/efscangraphic/futura-sh/xlight/) manually extending differently each letter. It's some sort [Engravers Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/engravers+gothic/)/ [Blair](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/blair/)/ [Sackers Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/sackers+gothic/) extended.  
Some more "Futura-like" (letters needing to be stretched: [Semplicita](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/semplicita-pro/), [Agenda](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/agenda/), [Contax Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeinnovations/contax-pro/), [Okojo](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wordshape/okojo/)  
Some "Extended Engravers Gothic": [Aviano Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/insigne/aviano-sans/), [Montag](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/insigne/montag/), [Sweet Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sweet/sans-pro/), [Luxury Gold](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/luxuryfonts), [Capline](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/typography.net/try/?ff=42&f=410), [Zeppelin (41)](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/zeppelin/), [Doublewide](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/betatype/doublewide/), [Adrianna](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/adrianna/), [Biondi Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/biondi-sans/), [Halogen](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/positype/halogen/), [Idlewid](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100043), [Burin Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/burin-sans/), [Ronsard Crystal](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/ronsard-crystal/)

Thanks to all for the info so far!

I should have made the "Brook Street" identification process easier from the beginning. Please see the images at the following link (I took screenshots from the Smythson site): [http://imgur.com/a/lr9X9](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328/http:/imgur.com/a/lr9X9 "http://imgur.com/a/lr9X9")
Anyone? (Please see the link I posted above with screenshots of "Brook Street" - Smythson)

Smythson appears to have a custom logo and to use a number of proprietary fonts. One of them has an internal name (in pdf's) of "Add-GermainCup". Others include AddLower-BrookW and AddLower-BrookB. One of these is quite close (but not identical to) the logo
Thanks HVB to confirm what I've said. So definitely custom typefaces exclusively for SMYTHSON. So, you could still have a look to my previous suggestions.

Thanks for the feedback.

I was just confused because users kept mentioning the Smythson logo, and I wasn't sure if people were actually analyzing the font in the link to screenshots I posted on Feb 18

Here's a closer look to Brook Street embedded as webfont on Smythson website. Definitely very close to some Engravers Gothic/Blair/Sackers Gothic, for the caps at least. Lowercases is serifed though, the very big difference.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140925100328im_/http:/typophile.com/files/brooke_6635.png)
